intro: Clidemia bonplandii, commonly known as the silverleaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of silver or gray hairs, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Clidemia bonplandii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
